name: A Fully Faithful Functor is Pseudomonic
comments: Proof: A fully faithful functor F is faithful (injective on hom-sets) and induces bijections F: Hom_C(X,Y) -> Hom_D(F(X),F(Y)). In particular, the restriction to isomorphisms F: Iso_C(X,Y) -> Iso_D(F(X),F(Y)) is also bijective, so F is full on isomorphisms. Thus F is pseudomonic.
